intro: Castelaria spinosa, commonly known as the spiny castelaria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiny stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Castelaria spinosa is valued both for its ornamental appeal and its role in local ecosystems.
